adjectives.description: upscale (comparative more upscale, superlative most upscale)

entries.meaning: (US) Marked by wealth or quality; high-class; upmarket.
examples: In Rio de Janeiro, thousands protested in a gritty area far from the cityâ€™s upscale seaside districts. In other cities, demonstrators blocked roads, barged into City Council meetings or interrupted sessions of local lawmakers, clapping loudly and sometimes taking over the microphone.

verbs.description: upscale (third-person singular simple present upscales, present participle upscaling, simple past and past participle upscaled)

entries.meaning: To increase in size, to scale up.
